pages.name: Parenting time
pages.description: Parenting time is the time each guardian spends with the child.  Guardians can arrange parenting time in any way that is in the best interests of the child.  Parenting time can be shared equally, or one guardian can have the child more of the time.

elements.name: parentingTimeOrder
elements.title: Are you applying for an order about parenting time?

elements.name: parentGuardianApplicant
elements.title: I am a parent or guardian of the child(ren)

elements.name: applyingGuardianApplicant
elements.title: I am a parent or guardian of the child(ren)

elements.name: ifChildFAQ
elements.title: You need to complete a 'Contact with a Child' application.

elements.name: applicantDesiredParentingTime
elements.title: I am asking for the {childWording} to spend time with me as follows:
elements.description: You can give as much detail as you would like to ask the court to include in the order. You know your family. If you think lots of detail is needed, make sure you make that clear here. You should think about a calendar: where will your child be on different days, including holidays and vacations.

elements.name: conditionedApplicantParentingTime
elements.description: Consider if there should be any conditions related to the parenting time. Conditions may include things like a child’s participation in extra-curricular activities, religious or cultural events, visits by extended family or friends during parenting time, or where the parenting time will take place.
elements.title: Do you think the court order should include any conditions related to your parenting time?

elements.name: ApplicantParentingTimeConditions
elements.title: Please describe the conditions you are willing to have on your parenting time:
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about what you mean and what you are asking the court to order.

elements.name: respondentDesiredParentingTime
elements.title: I am asking for the {childWording} to spend time with the other party as follows:
elements.description: You can give as much detail as you would like to ask the court to include in the order. You know your family. If you think lots of detail is needed, make sure you make that clear here. You should think about a calendar: where will your child be on different days, including holidays and vacations.

elements.name: conditionedRespondentParentingTime
elements.description: Consider if there should be any conditions related to the parenting time. Conditions may include things like a child’s participation in extra-curricular activities, religious or cultural events, visits by extended family or friends during parenting time, or where the parenting time will take place.
elements.title: Do you think the court order should include any conditions related to the other party’s parenting time?

elements.name: RespondentParentingTimeConditions
elements.title: Please describe the conditions you are willing to have on your parenting time:
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about what you mean and what you are asking the court to order.

elements.name: existingType
elements.title: Which do you have:

elements.name: ifNeitherexistingFAQ
elements.title: You need to reselect the correct existing order/agreement in the 'Background' page.

elements.name: orderDate
elements.title: What is the date the order was made?

elements.name: agreementDate
elements.title: What is the date the agreement was made?

elements.name: ChangeExplanationFAQ
elements.title: Family dynamics change and children grow up.  A parenting order that was made in the past may not make sense anymore. The court can only change an order if there has been a change in the needs or circumstances of the child since the original court order or written agreement was made, including a change in the circumstances of another person such as a parent.

elements.name: changesSinceOrder
elements.title: Describe the change in circumstances since the order was made
elements.description: Explain to the court what has changed that makes the existing order no longer appropriate. You don't have to use any special wording. The key is to be clear with your explanation.

elements.name: changesSinceAgreement
elements.title: Describe the change in circumstances since the agreement was made
elements.description: Explain to the court what has changed that makes the existing agreement no longer appropriate. You don't have to use any special wording. The key is to be clear with your explanation.

elements.name: notChildBestInterest
elements.title: how is the current agreement not in the best interest of the child(ren)?

elements.name: orderDifferenceType
elements.title: Do want the existing order changed or cancelled?

elements.name: agreementDifferenceType
elements.title: Do want the existing agreement set-aside or replaced?

elements.name: changeParentalResponsibilities
elements.description: Parental responsibilities are the decisions guardians make about their child, including daily care and supervision, education, medical treatment, receiving information about the child from others, and protecting the child's legal and financial interests.  Guardians share parental responsibilities unless they have a court order or agreement that says otherwise.  The Family Law Act provides a list of parental responsibilities.
elements.title: Are you asking to change the parental responsibilities of the guardians?

elements.name: existingOrderChangeParentalResponsibilitiesDescription
elements.title: Describe the changes to parental responsibilities you are asking for
elements.description:
If there is more than one guardian for a child, a court order can help to make it clear who can make which parenting decisions and when. Parenting decisions may be made together, by only one guardian, or divided between more than one guardian. You must carefully consider which way is best for the child.

You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about what you mean and what you are asking the court to order.

elements.name: existingAgreementChangeParentalResponsibilitiesDescription
elements.title: Describe the changes to parental responsibilities you are asking for
elements.description:
If there is more than one guardian for a child, a court agreement can help to make it clear who can make which parenting decisions and when. Parenting decisions may be made together, by only one guardian, or divided between more than one guardian. You must carefully consider which way is best for the child.

You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about what you mean and what you are asking the court to order.

elements.name: changeParentalTime
elements.description: Parenting time is the time each guardian spends with the child.  Guardians can arrange parenting time in any way that is in the best interests of the child.  Parenting time can be shared equally, or one guardian can have the child more of the time.
elements.title: Are you asking to change the parenting time schedule?

elements.name: existingOrderChangeParentalTimeDescription
elements.title: Describe the changes to parenting time that you are asking for
elements.description: You can give as much detail as you would like to ask the court to include in the order, you do not need to use any special wording.  You know your family.  If you think lots of detail is needed, make sure you make that clear here.

elements.name: existingAgreementChangeParentalTimeDescription
elements.title: Describe the changes to parenting time that you are asking for
elements.description: You can give as much detail as you would like to ask the court to include in the agreement, you do not need to use any special wording.  You know your family.  If you think lots of detail is needed, make sure you make that clear here.

elements.name: changeOtherOrder
elements.description: There may be other orders about parenting arrangements that don't seem to fit under parental responsibilities or parenting time. This may include important things like the child's residence, cooperating with travel arrangements, and what you agree to do to try to solve any disagreements on joint decisions about what is best for the child.
elements.title: Are you asking to change some other order about parenting arrangements?

elements.name: changeOtherAgreement
elements.description: There may be other agreements about parenting arrangements that don't seem to fit under parental responsibilities or parenting time. This may include important things like the child's residence, cooperating with travel arrangements, and what you agree to do to try to solve any disagreements on joint decisions about what is best for the child.
elements.title: Are you asking to change some other agreement about parenting arrangements?

elements.name: existingOrderChangeOtherDescription
elements.title: Describe the changes to parenting order that you are asking for
elements.description: You can give as much detail as you would like to ask the court to include in the order, you do not need to use any special wording.  You know your family.

elements.name: existingAgreementChangeOtherDescription
elements.title: Describe the changes to parenting agreement that you are asking for
elements.description: You can give as much detail as you would like to ask the court to include in the agreement, you do not need to use any special wording.  You know your family.
